reviews.review_msg: (This is for CMPT 985 because I can't add a course code) The course is engaging and interactive. The professor really made efforts to make the stuff funny and high quality. Professor is strict but not tough. I think this is helping us reach our goals. Course is very interesting, but please be well prepared to work and deliver your best!
The course was really nice. Prof Manolis is very approachable and fun to interact too. I agree that grading was bit of a bummer but otherwise he is a nice prof to learn with.

Professor Savva is great. The course is heavy though (the professor warned about it at the beginning the course but we had to take it anyway since its a mandatory course for thesis students). Furthermore, most of the students agree that the grading schema was unreasonable. But generally I learnt a lot.

I was expecting an A+. Got an A since there was a 99.1% threshold for A+ which was unnecessarily high. Lots of assignments and presentations. Assignments on weekends. No respect for students' time at all.

Judging by the course content, it was a great course. However, I spent too much time on this course and in the end, the professor only gave A+ to those who graded exactly more than 99.1/100. Since the grading process in a course like this with lots of assignments is VERY noisy, I believe being this though on grading was not fair at all.

Although some contents were useful, these parts could be a ~2hour video. There was no respect for students' personal time as there were assignments starting on Fri mid-night and due on Sun -or on the reading break. Also, he added many new assignments in the middle of the semester. The final grading didn't make sense. Grades more than 99.1% were A+.
